alert.note: Alert for Central Sacramento Valley; Motherlode; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 10:54AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Alpine, Placer, Amador, northwestern Tuolumne, northeastern Sacramento, northeastern San Joaquin, north central Stanislaus, El Dorado, southeastern Butte, Calaveras, Sierra, northeastern Yuba and Nevada Counties through 1145 AM PST... At 1049 AM PST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Downieville to Georgetown to Manteca. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain with wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. Heavy snow for elevations above 5000 feet. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects, with local power outages possible. Local flooding on roads and low lying areas. Heavy snow could bring whiteout conditions in the mountains. Locations impacted include... Stockton, Roseville, Folsom, Rocklin, Auburn, Grass Valley, Placerville, Jackson, Downieville, San Andreas, Cisco, Calaveras Big Trees SP, Kirkwood, Carson Pass, Blue Canyon, Big Bend Summit, Soda Springs, Bear Valley, Sierra City and Baxter. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Sacramento Valley; Motherlode; Northeast Foothills, Sacramento Valley; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada
